poem.title: The Slave Trade
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Strange, of all the ships I loved the ugliest, the dredger. On the skids, to launch it, smite its bow With a Robertson's Golly jam- Jar full of frog spawn. Dug-up funfair Cranking up its dredge At Central Bridge. Well The Clyde made Glasgow do it And Glasgow made a right mess of the Clyde.
